clinical_study.brief_title: Liver Health and Metabolic Function in People With Obesity
clinical_study.official_title: Liver Health and Metabolic Function in People With Obesity

brief_summary.textblock: This project aims to determine the effect of significant weight loss on rates on hepatic fibrogenesis in people with obesity.

detailed_description.textblock: Non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD) affects approximately 70% of those with obesity and if left untreated can progress to cirrhosis and liver failure. NAFLD stages progress from the stage of simple steatosis to steatohepatitis, and fibrosis The stage of NAFLD is currently best determined using histology from a liver biopsy, however this provides a static depiction of the state of the liver. Therefore This project aims to determine fibrogenesis in the liver of obese humans in vivo, before and after weight loss.
